title: Daily Evening Bhagavatam Discourse | HH Stoka Krishna Swami | SB 1.12.29 part 1 | 09-09-2022
speaker: HH Stoka Krishna Swami

segments.text: ओम अज्ञानति मिरान्धस्य ज्ञानांजनिषलाकया चक्षरुन्मीलितं येनातस्मैश्री गुरवे नमः
नमा ओम विष्णु पादाया कृष्ण प्रिष्ठाय भूतले श्री मते भक्ति वेदान्त स्वामिन्निति नामिने
नमस्ते सारस्वते देवे गौरवाणी प्रचारिने निर्विशेशा शून्यवादी पाश्चात्यदेशतारिने
जय श्री कृष्ण चैतन्या प्रभू नित्यानन्दा श्री अद्वैत गदाधरा श्रीवासादी गौरभक्त वृन्दा
हरे कृष्णा हरे कृष्णा कृष्ट कृष्णा हरे हरे हरे रामा हरे रामा रामा रामा हरे हरे
ओम्नमो भगवते वासुदेवाया नारायणम नमस्कृत्या नरम्चैवनरोत्तमं देवीम सरस्वतीम व्यासं ततो जयमुदीरयेत।
इतिराज्ञ उपादिश्य विप्रा जातक कोविदाह लब्ध अपचितय सर्वे प्रतिजग्म स्वकान गृहान।
दस दोस्व वर एक्सपर्ट इन अस्ट्रोलोजियों प्रतिजग्म स्वकान गृहान।
दस दोस्व वर एक्सपर्टिजग्म स्वकान गृहान।

to suffer four fundamental miseries, janma, mrutyu, jara, vyadhi, dukkha, dosha, anu, darshanam, I mentioned this several times in the past, and also the three impositions of material nature, adhi daivika klesha, adhyatmika klesha, adhibhautika klesha, everyone suffers this throughout the universe,
so, we cannot be completely free from all suffering in material existence, simply by performing pious activities, materially pious activities,
so, that is particularly highlighted in the spiritual knowledge given in this book,
in the Vedas, while people are engrossed in the material knowledge, either given by modern books of knowledge, or given by the Vedas,
they forget the ultimate reality of material existence, which in essence is simply suffering,
all those who have born, have to die,
in the Bhagavad Gita, second chapter, Krishna says,
of one who has taken birth in this material world, it is certain that such person will have to die,
and the example is in the Bhagavatam, here are Nikashipa who wanted to be immortal in that very body that he had taken birth,
and Brahma said, no, you cannot be immortal in this body, nobody can be immortal, even Brahma cannot be immortal in the same body in which he has taken birth,
even he has to leave his body, therefore, the Vedas instruct us, especially Bhagavad Gita,
which gives the essence of the Vedic wisdom, the spiritual wisdom in the Vedas, that you are spirit soul,
and as spirit soul, you are entitled to spiritual bliss, eternal life of spiritual bliss and spiritual knowledge,
Satchidananda, state of existence, and that is possible by realizing yourself as spiritual by nature,
same quality as Krishna, the Supreme.
and such realization is perfected by Krishna consciousness, by bhakti yoga, not by any other method,
therefore, Srila Prabhupada says, the knowledge of the Vedas ultimately aims at perfection of self-realization,
in other words, Srila Prabhupada says, the Vedas are the guides for the civilized man in every respect,
since human life is the opportunity to get free from all material miseries,
it is properly guided by the knowledge of the Vedas in the matters of both material needs and spiritual salvation.
